title: How to Create a New Profile in Microsoft Outlook
author: William Saverimuthu
summary: A comprehensive guide on how to create a new profile in Microsoft Outlook.

content.content: Creating a new profile in Microsoft Outlook can help you manage multiple email accounts or set up a fresh environment for troubleshooting. Follow these steps to create a new profile:
Step 1: Open Control Panel
Press the Windows key on your keyboard and type 'Control Panel'. Click on the Control Panel app to open it.

content.caption: Accessing the Control Panel from the Start menu.

content.content: Step 2: Navigate to Mail Settings
In the Control Panel, set the view to 'Small icons' or 'Large icons' for easier navigation. Click on 'Mail (Microsoft Outlook)'. This will open the Mail Setup dialog box.

content.caption: Finding the Mail settings in Control Panel.

content.content: Step 3: Open Profiles
In the Mail Setup dialog box, click on 'Show Profiles'.

content.caption: Opening the profiles section in Mail Setup.

content.content: Step 4: Add a New Profile
In the Mail dialog box, click on 'Add...'. Enter a name for your new profile in the 'Profile Name' field. Click 'OK'.

content.caption: Creating a new profile in Outlook.

content.content: Step 5: Configure Email Account

The Add Account dialog box will appear. Here, you can configure your email account. Automatic Setup: Enter your name, email address, and password, then click 'Next'. Manual Setup: Select 'Manual setup or additional server types' and click 'Next'. Follow the prompts to enter your account details.

content.caption: Entering account details for new profile.

content.content: Step 6: Finish Setup
Once your account is set up, click 'Finish'. Your new profile will appear in the list of profiles.
Step 7: Set Default Profile (Optional)
If you want to set the new profile as your default profile, select 'Always use this profile' and choose the new profile from the dropdown menu. Click 'OK'.

content.caption: Setting the new profile as the default profile.

content.content: Step 8: Open Outlook with New Profile
Open Microsoft Outlook. If you set the new profile as default, it will open with that profile. If not, you'll be prompted to choose a profile each time you start Outlook.

content.caption: Choosing a profile when starting Outlook.

title: Essential Terminal Commands for macOS Power Users
author: William Saverimuthu
summary: Unlock the full potential of your Mac with these powerful Terminal commands.

content.content: While macOS offers a user-friendly GUI, the Terminal provides unparalleled control for power users. Here are some essential commands to enhance your Mac experience.
1. Reveal Hidden Files
Use this command to show hidden files in Finder: defaults write com.apple.finder AppleShowAllFiles YES

content.alt: Hidden files revealed in macOS Finder
content.caption: Finder window showing hidden files after using the Terminal command

content.content: 2. Caffeine: Prevent Sleep Mode
Keep your Mac awake with this command: caffeinate -t 3600

content.caption: Using the caffeinate command to prevent sleep mode
